# Electromagnetic Field Theory

## Mathematical Preliminaries

* Phasors
* Phasor Arithmetic
* Scalars & Vectors

A time-harmonic fuunction can be written as

$$y(t) = A \cos(\omega t + \theta)$$

The math becomes easier if we simplify it with

$$e^{j \theta} = \cos(\theta) + j \sin(\theta) \tag{Euler's Formula}$$
$$y(t) = Re[ A e^{j(\omega t + \theta)} ]= Re[ A e^{j\omega t} e^{j\theta} ]$$
